thread.title: Marquez takes pole in Australia, Lorenzo third
thread.title_full: Marquez takes pole in Australia, Lorenzo third | Reuters

author: Ian Ransom
title: Marquez takes pole in Australia, Lorenzo third
text:
MELBOURNE Outgoing champion Marc Marquez swept to his eighth pole position of the season at the Australian MotoGP on Saturday, as Jorge Lorenzo took a front-row position to keep his title hopes alive.
Honda rider Marquez came out early to top the timesheets and finished with a fastest lap of one minute 28.364 seconds, three-tenths quicker than Ducati's Andrea Iannone and Yamaha's Lorenzo, who shared the same best lap times.
Championship leader Valentino Rossi, 18 points ahead of Lorenzo with three races left, will start a disappointing seventh on the grid, opening the door for his Spanish rival Lorenzo to keep the pressure on.
Honda rider Dani Pedrosa will start on the second row, with fifth fastest Briton Cal Crutchlow and sixth fastest Suzuki rider Maverick Vinales.
In the Moto3 category, Saxoprint RTGâ€™s John McPhee took his first ever pole ahead of Miguel Oliveira and Efren Vazquez after championship leader Danny Kent was hit with a six-place grid penalty for riding slowly on the racing line during free practice.
Qualifying for Moto2 starts later on Saturday.
(Editing by Peter Rutherford )
